title: Man Utd fans continue protests against Glazers and Ed Woodward ahead of Liverpool clash

Furious Manchester United supporters continued their protests against the Glazer family and Ed Woodward ahead of their clash with Liverpool on Sunday.

The Red Devils faithful have protested against the Glazers in recent years, with frustration increasing after a miserable start to 2019/20 which has seen the club endure their worst start to a league season in 30 years.

The club's owners and chief executive Woodward have been in the firing line, rather than boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

And ahead of their mouthwatering match with Liverpool, supporters marched to Old Trafford with a banner saying: "Glazers Out. Woodward Out. Over £1b stolen from MUFC."

A banner was also flown over the stadium prior to kick off, reading: "Ed still failing. Woodward out."

(Image: PA)

Solskjaer's side have had a lot of soul-searching to do over the international break after the shock loss at embattled Newcastle left them just two points off the Premier League relegation zone.

Liverpool are looking to compound United's worst start in 30 years on Sunday, when Jurgen Klopp's men will aim for a record-equalling 18th successive top-flight victory.

Meanwhile Manchester United executive vice-chairman Woodward claimed on Sunday that the Glazer family are "in it for the long term".

The Glazers completed their controversial takeover at Old Trafford in 2005, with their ownership the subject of intense focus ever since.

(Image: Getty Images)

It was reported on Sunday that the Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman is preparing to make a third takeover bid for United, but Woodward believes the current owners are staying put.

"Based on what I see, they're in it for the long term," the executive vice-chairman said.

"With regards to offers or asking prices, my understanding is that there have been no discussions for a price for the club or anything like that.

"(I think they are in it for the long-term) because every conversation we have is based on the long-term."
description: Manchester United fans have protested against the Glazers in recent years, with frustration increasing after a slow start to the campaign
